Title: Executive Assistant
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.
Wayfair, one of the largest retailers of home furnishings and housewares in the United States, has an immediate need for an Executive Assistant to manage the day-to-day activities for leaders across our Marketing and Specialty Retail Brand teams. This is a fantastic opportunity for the right individual to support the senior leaders of one of the fastest-growing companies in Boston. The ideal candidate will bring strong organizational and planning skills, detail orientation, a high sense of urgency, a sense of humor, and problem-solving abilities to the role. This person should be smart, engaging, fun, curious, and unflappable.
Wayfairs team of Executive Assistants play a crucial role in supporting executives. Their responsibilities include scheduling and coordinating meetings, managing travel arrangements, and opportunities to own projects across different operational functions. This position offers a unique opportunity for an experienced executive assistant looking to elevate their career.
What Youll Do:

Executive Support: Provide support for 3-6 leaders in Marketing and Specialty Retail Brands. Enhance the executives' efficiency and effectiveness through comprehensive support. 
Calendar Management: Organize and manage all aspects of internal and external meetings with the ability to schedule and prioritize meetings, resolve schedule conflicts, collaborate with other team members, and stay several steps ahead to maintain efficiency.
Travel Management: Arrange all travel details, both domestic and international, with the ability to make frequent revisions as necessary.
Expense Management: Handle monthly business expense reports, ensuring timely and accurate processing.
Event Planning: Support with planning, coordination and execution of team events.
Customer Focus: Maintain a customer-centric approach, ask pertinent questions in meetings, and readily adapt to new challenges.
Teamwork and Positivity: Foster a collaborative team environment, keep a positive attitude, and proactively support colleagues and company events.
Admin Coverage: Provide coverage for members of the leadership support team as needed.
Thrive in a fast-paced workplace by effectively multitasking and managing competing priorities.

What Youll Need:

At least 2+ years of experience as Administrative Assistant/Executive Assistant for senior level executives.  
Ability to be assertive and give push-back as needed.
Meticulous attention to detail and strong planning and forward-thinking capabilities.
Flexible and be able to adapt quickly to last-minute changes, taking them in stride while maintaining a pleasant manner and motivating spirit.
Demonstrated ability to anticipate needs and situations before they are fully developed.
Advanced proficiency in Google Enterprise Suite tools (calendar, mail drive, docs, sheets, slides, meet).
Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.
Extremely high level of discretion pertaining to confidential information.

Title: Data Scientist II, Customer Technology Data Science
RoleDescription:
Wayfair Data Science is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Wayfair websites generate over 100M clicks from the millions of customers that visit our sites every day to discover and purchase home goods. The Customer Tech Data Science team is focused on understanding and optimizing customer behavior on the website and mobile application as a key enabler for the company to move fast and iterate quickly on big business problems.
At their core, the Customer Tech Data Science team at Wayfair are strong in quantitative analysis, enjoy coding but also want to balance that with their interest in business and applying advanced modeling techniques. They think critically to tackle complex challenges, thrive in a fast-paced environment and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they will have an immediate impact on day one. There are significant opportunities for new team members to emerge as leaders, taking on additional projects and responsibilities with strong performance.
 
What Youll Do:

Construct optimized code that massages information from multi-terabyte data sources including sales, clickstream, logistics, product, and customer databases to deliver business insights and recommendations.
Collaborate with all facets of the organization including product management, engineering, and creative design to identify the most impactful ways for data and analytics to drive decision making and accelerate profitable growth.
Become the subject matter expert for data, analytics, and testing for your area to ensure accurate and proper interpretation of core business metrics and consumer behavior.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests to make high-impact changes to the customer experience.
Perform deep-dive analysis, including the application of advanced analytical techniques, to solve some of the more critical and complex business problems.
Develop data visualizations, including reports, dashboards, and analyses in Looker and GBQ to distribute data insights in an easily digestible manner.

What You'll Need:

Bachelors in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
3+ years of work experience in a relevant field, such as analytics or data science.
Proficient knowledge of a statistical programming language such as Python, R, SAS, or SPSS.
Proficient knowledge of SQL (incl. Aggregate functions, joins, etc.).
Experience conducting quantitative analyses on large and complex data sets.

Title: Senior Analyst, Operations Business Analytics
RoleDescription:
At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.
At Wayfair, were building industry-shaping Operations infrastructure and capabilities to fuel growth and delight our customers. Were seeking bright, curious, and high-energy project managers to execute strategic initiatives that will propel Wayfair to $20B in sales and beyond.
Returns and Incident Prevention is a key priority for our business. We know that customers dont always love the product they receive or that issues can arise throughout an order. Our goal is to prevent these returns & incidents proactively in the supply chain to drive customer happiness and reduce financial exposure, contributing to the companys overall profitability and growth. Our team works with counterparts across Fulfillment Centers, Home Delivery Operations, Product, Finance, Transportation Logistics and Process Definition teams to drive new approaches and processes that deliver profitability and customer experience improvements. This work is broad, business critical, complex and highly cross-functional. 
We are looking for a data-driven and impact-oriented person to drive an incident prevention roadmap within the supply chain that delivers on these objectives. The ideal candidate must be a highly flexible and hands on leader who understands how to effectively drive results in a fast-paced and rapidly growing company.
What You'll Do

Generate actionable insights for policy and operational improvements 
Create automated reporting and dashboards to support process owners in driving desirable outcomes
Translate KPI movements into recommendations for policy iteration, implementation, and process automation
Take ownership of building a strategic roadmap for your team based on the overall agenda to improve customer reported incident rates and reduce incident exposure
Manage multiple peer and upward technical and operational stakeholders to get their buy-in to implement on your policy recommendations
Operate as a cross functional think tank that understands customer needs and Wayfair & supplier processes, then define, design, deliver transformational resolution journeys
Partner with product teams to design and implement agile development roadmap to improve our customer and agent facing technology tools
Be an effective contributor in a team that manages multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment with effective communication and thorough follow through problem solve situations requiring use of data collection and analysis
Partner cross-functionally with groups company-wide, including Product, Finance, Fulfillment Centers, Industrial Engineering, Transportation to drive alignment and execution against innovative solutions to challenging commercial problems intended to reduce financial incident exposure and drive customer happiness
Contribute to the development of tools and processes that drive efficiencies for the team and simplify the day-to-day operations.
Be a great teammate! We seek candidates with a positive attitude, collaborative spirit, passion for solving problems, and a sense of humor.

What You'll Need

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field (e.g. engineering, economics, finance); Master's degree a plus
2-4 years total work experience, with previous experience in e-commerce, supply chain, reverse logistics, retail management, finance, or management consulting preferred. 
Advanced proficiency with SQL or Google Big Query along with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
Critical and quantitative thinking while also showcasing the acumen to selectively put qualitative insights over quantitative data
Team-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross-functional collaboration
Passion for process optimization and transformation - experience with complex operational, process, and performance improvement projects
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset; you must be adaptable and comfortable with change

Title: Sr. Analyst, Cross Channel Marketing
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.
*At this time, Wayfair does not provide sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.
The Sr. cross channel analyst is a marketing generalist who supports the CMO function for Wayfair Canada, specifically to drive performance marketing success. This person is the resident expert on marketing channel performance for the brands, steers the marketing strategic planning process (i.e., forecasting and roadmap collaboration), and leads the thinking on multi-channel marketing strategies (e.g, targeting) that improve channel effectiveness and customers health. 
What Youll Do:

Marketing Performance: Own the marketing performance narrative in all formal and informal touchpoints. Execute deep-dive investigations that span across channels (in partnership with marketing channel teams) to deliver actionable insights to department leadership. Own all formal reporting.
Channel Effectiveness: Deep understanding of full marketing funnel to serve as strategic thought partner to marketing channel teams. Hold individual channels accountable for test rigor and business results. Draw connections across channel roadmaps (e.g., between prospecting & email) to improve overall customer experience to amplify channel-specific performance. Promote a balanced focus on operational excellence.
Strategic Planning: Drive the ad spend forecasting process with the channel leads to ladder up into the broader quarterly P&L process, in partnership with Brand Finance. Intra-quarter, lead the monitoring and management of performance metrics against the forecast. 
Strategic Projects: Support investigation into cross-channel levers (e.g., personalization, targeting, retargeting) to improve customer growth / customer health. Serve as a project manager for complex multi-channel projects, ensuring scalability / sustainability of initiatives, knowledge-sharing and impactful results. 

What You Need: 

3+ years of experience in a performance marketing role.
Strong analytical skills with experience using tools such as SQL and Looker.
Experience developing roadmaps and informing marketing strategies.
Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously .
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to tailor updates to the appropriate audience (senior stakeholders, peers, analysts, etc.).
An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment with a dynamic bias for action.

Wayfair is a dynamic, cutting-edge technology company operating in the ecommerce space. Were committed to providing our customers with a best-in-class experience for all things home. Deep foundation of leveraging core SEO concepts (keyword research, user intent, crawlability, mobile-friendly, page speed, etc.)

Willingness to introduce and advocate for new ideas/approaches

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science, or related field.

Title: Safety & Security Administrator - Contract
RoleDescription:
Safety & Security Administrator - Contract 
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space. We are driven, determined and relentless about taking care of our people in a fast paced environment in a rapidly growing eCommerce company. The Global Safety & Security (GLOSS) team is a multifunctional team, providing risk mitigation support to Wayfairs diverse teams.
GLOSS is responsible for protecting team members and company assets. We support OHS and environmental compliance, intelligence collection and security protection initiatives. GLOSS members collaborate with multiple business partners at all levels on process improvements while evolving our organizational culture through an inclusive approach to health, safety, environment and security. GLOSS is growing! We are currently looking for a Safety & Security Supervisor for our Fulfillment Centre in the Mississauga, Ontario area.
The Safety and Security Site Administrator will be responsible for providing leadership on all safety, and asset protection related standards, systems, processes. Well versed in regional OHS and environmental legislation, the successful candidate will support site leadership in driving our safety and security program initiatives across the site. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing site leadership with options, recommendations, and best practices as a subject matter expert in safety and security. 
What Youll Do

Partner with operations to ensure the implementation and adherence of all aspects of our Injury and Illness Prevention Plan for assigned location.
Partner with the Global Safety and Security Business Support and Compliance Teams to support operations in executing Global Safety and Security initiatives.
Escalate requested changes and best practices to the Safety Compliance Team for review and standardization.
Anticipate, identify, evaluate hazardous conditions, and build practices to aid in all critical incident planning, preparation, and responses.
Conduct inspections of facilities to identify corrective actions and risk mitigation steps for potential hazards, security risks, and regulatory compliance concerns.
Partner cross-functionally with all levels of site management in assigned location to mitigate risk and resolve safety and security related issues.
Partner with site leadership in developing action plans to improve safety/security culture in assigned location and promote employee engagement in safety/security programs.
Partner with operations and key stakeholders, to ensure all new hires receive safety orientation, and verify annual training requirements for existing employees.
Assist in the implementation and execution of safety and security accountability programs.
Maintain effective working relationships with regulatory agencies, industry security and life safety professionals, vendors, and suppliers.
Prepare and submit incident reports in compliance with company and insurance carrier requirements. Support any related investigations.
Provide daily guidance to the third-party guard service. Ensure guards are following documented post orders. Work to ensure there are no gaps in guard coverage.
Conduct physical security, camera system and access control checks to ensure compliance. 

What Youll Need

2+ years in a dedicated, progressive Safety role with tangible exposure to asset protection techniques, or similar experience required. Bachelors Degree not required but preferred.
Lean Six-Sigma experience desired.
Demonstrated knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements that govern worker health and safety, physical assessment and ergonomic skills, and case management skills.
Knowledge of municipal, provincial, and federal occupational health, safety and environmental regulations and laws.
Demonstrated working knowledge of safety and security concepts, best practices, policies, programs, and procedures. Preferably in a distribution environment.
Working knowledge of conveyor safety, fork truck safety, hand tool safety and ergonomics.
Working knowledge of workers compensation case management.
Ability to handle multiple projects, set priorities, strong organizational and time management skills.
Flexibility to support multiple buildings across multiple shifts that are dynamic and have changing business needs.
Excellent analytical and organizational skills, with demonstrated experience in hypothesis-driven learning, turning data into actionable insights.
Superior communication skills with the ability to navigate a complex organization and generate buy-in for ideas and plans.
Entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for action and ability to deal with extreme ambiguity and rapidly changing environments.
Strong reputation for honesty, integrity, and professionalism, including an ability to maintain confide
Must be able to stand and or walk in a variety of weather and terrain conditions for shifts up to 10 hours.
Must be able to lift and hold 15 pounds.
Be able to work effectively in a warehouse environment with hot and cold conditions, equipment traffic, and possible loud noises. 
Ability to travel within your assigned area of responsibility. Occasional (10%) overnight travel is required.

Who We Are [IT Onboarding and Asset Management]
The Employee Tech IT Onboarding and IT Asset Management team, part of IT Shared Services, is responsible for ensuring all global new hires and internal employee transfers have all the technology they need when they start their new role with Wayfair as well as ensuring governance of the hardware management in Europe. Activities include administration of the IT asset inventory within the ServiceNow platform, collaborating with external processes and teams to include IT Procurement, IT Finance, Vendor Management in the collection of critical attributes supporting the effective and timely management of IT assets through their lifecycle.  This includes, but is not limited to; hardware sourcing and deployment, new hire onboarding and support, process efficiency implementations, and internal audit reporting.
We are looking for a high-energy, critical-thinking team member, who is dedicated to helping their manager drive growth, productivity, and results, while upholding the main goal of delivering great service to Wayfairians. This role is for someone who is comfortable working part time and helping Wayfair deliver results in the Onboarding and Assets space.

Manage onboarding inventory and stock of necessary computer hardware and peripheral accessories.
Improve the lifecycle of IT assets, including inventory, assignment, stockroom, harvesting, and disposal.
Utilize the ServiceNow Hardware/IT Asset Management product to execute or support regular audits of physical assets.
Create and publish monthly status inventories and usage positions, including global IT assets.
Drive continuous process improvements and partner with asset owners to ensure accurate and up-to-date asset information throughout the hardware lifecycle.
Maintain required component and emergency spare inventory levels at Berlin, DE, London, GBR, and Galway, IRE.
Support and lead orientation sessions to get new hires operational on their Day 1.
Ensure all New Hire Information is entered correctly and fulfilled, coordinating with the Global shipping vendor for fulfillment once fully implemented.
Work with 3rd party contractor agencies and Wayfair Talent Acquisition on new hire issues.
Work with internal stakeholders to meet hiring forecasts and coordinate on new hire onboarding.
Help the team meet or surpass established KPI goals (SLA, end-user survey, hardware metrics, NPS, etc.) for task completion.


Communicate effectively with end-users and co-workers across multiple platforms and mediums (email, instant messaging, phone, ticket updates, and in-person).

Title: Strategy & Analytics Manager
RoleDescription:
Job Description
Are you interested in helping shape the future of Wayfairs analytics and support driving insights and visibility across the business? Are you excited about being at the leading edge of Wayfairs commercial strategy, building the approach that will enable Wayfair to succeed both today and in the future?
As a Manager on the NAEURTA (North America & Europe Recipe, Tools, and Analytics) team, you will play a pivotal role in defining and executing cost, assortment and promotion strategies across Wayfair's global supplier base. Reporting to the Head of Global Recipe Performance, this individual drives measurable improvements in key cost-related metrics while enabling scalable supplier engagement and campaign execution in both the US and EU markets.
This is a highly cross-functional role, working closely with Category Management, Supplier Relationship Managers (SRMs), Profit Management, Pricing Algorithms, and Tech & Reporting teams to build tools, processes, and strategies that drive down costs, improve promotional depth, and deliver value to both Wayfair customers and suppliers.
How is this opportunity unique?
Wayfair is a data-driven environment. Candidates with experience using data to drive decision-making are great matches.
We move fast and take risks. If you loved working at a start-up or in another fast-paced, risk-taking environment, youd enjoy working at Wayfair. Be prepared to constantly evolve.
Confidence is key. The Retail Technology & Analytics team has a 360 view across suppliers, supplier-facing business teams, and internal Wayfair technology and product teams. Youll need to be able to gain buy-in from senior leaders and cross-functional teams to accomplish your goals.
Our business is in high-growth stage and so is our team. Were looking for team members who are ready and eager to get their hands dirty and drive results right away.
What You'll Do

Own and evolve Wayfairs global cost and promotional strategy, with a focus on driving competitiveness in everyday pricing and major promotional events (e.g., Way Day, Cyber Week).
Lead NA & EU-wide cost strategy and sprints , driving aggressive base cost negotiations through scalable comms, bulk recommendations, and talk tracks.
Partner with cross-functional teams and stakeholders  (Global Partner support team, Profit Management, engineering) to design and enhance tools  to support CM and supplier decision-making. (e.g Negotiation Hub, Cost Stack,etc)
Align North America and European approaches for campaigns, ensuring localization without sacrificing scalability.
Improve product cost level and drive deep promotional cost reduction for major events through supplier marketing levers, appcues, and discount strategy coordination.
Build and deliver training to Category Managers on new cost tools, negotiation strategies, and best practices.
Lead the roadmap for tech changes related to cost management, including B2B promotions, cost end date functionality, and base cost migration from superrooms.
Monitor adoption and impact of new tools and strategies, and provide ongoing reporting and feedback to senior stakeholders.

What You'll Need

Strong quantitative skills: ability to develop analytical methodologies and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, vet and pressure-test data, and synthesize findings
Strong communication skills: ability to succinctly summarize and tailor your communication style to your audience (e.g., senior business stakeholders versus technical product teams). 
Skilled in cross-functional program management, with experience working in a global or matrixed organization.
Strong problem-solving skills: ability to dissect and determine root causes, and vet / prioritize potential solutions (near- and long-term)
Strong prioritization skills: consistent nose for value, prioritizing potential projects / features based on impact to the business
Ability to learn and act quickly, making decisions and drawing conclusions in the face of ambiguity
Strategic thinker with deep experience in pricing, vendor negotiations, and promotional effectiveness.
Experience in working with complex tooling ecosystems and leading roadmap development with technical teams.
Experience managing others 
Advanced Excel and familiarity with SQL, Looker, or similar BI tools. 
5 -8  years experience in a strategy, pricing, merchandising, or consulting role.
Strong understanding of B2B/B2C retail economics and digital marketplace dynamics.

Title: Senior Associate, Labor Planning
RoleDescription:
This role is an onsite position based out of one of our Final Mile Centers in Norton, MA or Linden, NJ. 
The Senior Associate of Labor Planning plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.
